alert.note: Alert for Camden; Pasquotank; Western Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 3:09PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A CLUSTER OF SHOWERS WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL CAMDEN...CENTRAL PASQUOTANK AND CENTRAL CURRITUCK COUNTIES THROUGH 400 PM EDT... At 308 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of showers capable of producing landspouts near Indiantown, or near Camden, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. These showers will be near... Indiantown around 315 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Belcross, Aydlett, Gregory, Barco, Coinjock, Riddle, Spences Corner, Sligo, Lambs Corner, and Bartlett. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
